ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Assessment type
Notes: 1=TADS GATE A; 2=TADS GATE B; 3 = TADS Gate C; 4 = TADS Week 6; 5 = TADS Week 12; 6 = TADS Week 18; 7 = TADS Week 24; 8 = TADS Week 30; 9 = TADS Week 36; 10 = TADS F/U Mo 3; 11 = TADS F/U Mo 6; 12 = TADS F/U Mo 9; 13 = TADS F/U Mo 12; 14 = SOFTAD month 6; 15 = SOFTAD month 12; 16 = SOFTAD month 18; 17 = SOFTAD month 24; 18 = SOFTAD month 30; 19 = SOFTAD month 36; 20 = SOFTAD month 42

ElementDescription: Study stage
Notes: 0 = Pre-Randomization (TADS) 1 = Stage 1 (TADS) 2 = Stage 2 (TADS) 3 = Stage 3 (TADS) 4 = Stage 4 (TADS) 5 = Stage 5 (SOFTAD); 51=Treatmentas Usual; 52=Screening Alone; 53=Intervention; 67=Unknown; -888=Not Applicable; -999=Missing;

ElementDescription: Question 1. Over the past week, how have things been with your health? (Imputed Version). Imputation Rule: if less than 4 of PQLQ1_U through PQLQ15_U are missing and PQLQ1 is missing then PQLQ1 = integer(median of non-missing PQLQ1_U through PQLQ15_U)
Notes: 1 = Very Poor; 2 = Poor; 3 = Fair; 4 = Good; 5 = Very Good

ElementDescription: Question 2. Over the past week, how have things been with your mood or feelings? (Imputed Version). Imputation Rule: if less than 4 of PQLQ1_U through PQLQ15_U are missing and PQLQ2 is missing then PQLQ2 = integer(median of non-missing PQLQ1_U through PQLQ15_U)
Notes: 1 = Very Poor; 2 = Poor; 3 = Fair; 4 = Good; 5 = Very Good

ElementDescription: PQLQ Total Score using imputed values
Notes: Items included in score: PQLQ1 through PQLQ15

ElementDescription: How affected/burdened do you feel internally (mentally) and/or externally (organization) by your child's examinations or treatment?
Notes: 1=Not at all; 2=A little; 3=Moderately; 4=Strongly; 5=Very strongly; 9=Missing

ElementDescription: Hours per day at school
Notes: Number of hours; 99=Missing

ElementDescription: Hours per day doing homework (alone or with others)
Notes: Number of hours; 99=Missing

ElementDescription: Hours per day with parents, siblings (e.g. at meals, having fun, playing games, etc.)
Notes: Number of hours; 99=Missing

ElementDescription: Hours per day with friends in their free time (e.g. playing games, joining a club, doing other activities, hanging out)
Notes: Number of hours; 99=Missing

ElementDescription: Hours per day alone (e.g. sitting alone in room playing, listening to music, using the computer, watching TV, reading, doing hobbies).
Notes: Number of hours; 99=Missing

Notes: Number of hours; 99=Missing

ElementDescription: Form used/assessment name
Respondent
Notes: NA=Not Applicable

ElementDescription: Target/Subject of this form
Notes: 0=Proband; 1=Sibling of proband; 2=Other relative of proband; 3=Offspring of proband; 4=Control

ElementDescription: How independently can you act (at play, on a hobby, in other activities)? / How independently can your child act (at play, on a hobby, in other activities)?
Notes: 0=Not applicable; 1=Very well; 2=Fairly well; 3=Average; 4=Rather poorly; 5=Very poorly; 9=Missing

ElementDescription: How burdensome is the problem or illness that brought you here? / How burdensome is the problem or illness that brought your child here?
Notes: 1=Not at all; 2=A little; 3=Moderately; 4=Strongly; 5=Very strongly; 9=Missing

ElementDescription: How burdensome is treatment for the problem or illness that brought you (your child) here?
Notes: 1=Not at all; 2=A little; 3=Moderately; 4=Strongly; 5=Very strongly; 9=Missing

ElementDescription: How affected/burdened do you feel internally (mentally) and/or externally (organizationally) due to your child's problem/illness?
Notes: 1=Not at all; 2=A little; 3=Moderately; 4=Strongly; 5=Very strongly; 9=Missing
